title: Training starts but GPU remains inactive
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Training for a dataset begins but after hours there are still no iterations and the GPU activity of my machine is at zero

### Operating System

Windows 10.0.18362
python 3.8.12

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version= 2.2.03

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

GeForce RTX 2080 SUPER

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Go to Envs of anaconda navigator and open DEEPLABCUT with ipython
2. Import deeplabcut
3.  Train network with previously labeled data from older DLC `deeplabcut.train_network('config path\config.yaml', shuffle=1,trainingsetindex=0,gputouse=0,max_snapshots_to_keep=5, displayiters=1000,saveiters=20000, maxiters=500000)`

### Relevant log output

```shell

Starting training....
```


### Anything else?

Sometimes get the error message `Starting training....
Could not load library cudnn_ops_infer64_8.dll. Error code 126
Please make sure cudnn_ops_infer64_8.dll is in your library path!`
But this seems to go away when I paste the file cudnn_ops_infer64_8.dll into `E:\Clark` which is where my labeled dataset is `E:\Clark\DLC\Redfish1-Brendan-2021-08-26`

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
